dataSetInformation.common:generalComment: Contaminated groundwater refers to the presence of hazardous or toxic chemicals and materials in groundwater, making it unusable and posing serious health, environmental, and socio-economic risks. Causes include leaks, spills, and improper disposal of oil or chemical wastes, which can seep through soil and contaminate groundwater sources. Nearby water supply wells can become polluted, forcing people to seek alternative water sources. Biological contaminants such as bacteria, viruses, protozoans, and pathogens, as well as naturally occurring chemicals and those from human activities, can be present. Vapor intrusion describes the movement of hazardous vapors from contaminated soil or groundwater into indoor air spaces.

受污染的地下水是指地下水中存在有害或有毒化学品和材料，使地下水无法使用，并对健康、环境和社会经济造成严重危害。造成污染的原因包括石油或化学废料的泄漏、溢出和不当处置，它们会渗入土壤并污染地下水源。附近的供水井会受到污染，迫使人们寻找其他水源。细菌、病毒、原生动物和病原体等生物污染物，以及自然产生的化学物质和人类活动产生的化学物质都可能存在。蒸汽入侵是指有害蒸汽从受污染的土壤或地下水进入室内空气空间。
